meanings.definition: A scab or crust that forms over a wound or sore.
meanings.sent1: After I fell and scraped my knee, an escar formed to protect the cut.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the escar was a natural part of the healing process.
meanings.sent3: The escar on his elbow looked like a tiny shield protecting him.
meanings.sent4: Her escar was like a tiny bridge over the wound, keeping it safe.
meanings.sent5: The escar felt rough to the touch, like a little armor for the injury.

meanings.definition: To form a scab or crust over a wound or sore.
meanings.sent1: If you pick at the scab, it will take longer for the wound to escar.
meanings.sent2: The wound started to escar over, signaling the beginning of the healing process.
meanings.sent3: She watched in fascination as the wound began to escar over slowly.
meanings.sent4: The scab seemed to escar over the wound like a protective layer.
meanings.sent5: The wound will escar over naturally if you keep it clean and dry.
